NEWS OF THE CONFERENCE
THE SOCIABLE SHELTER: We are pleased to inform you that Mr. Hoyt B, Wooten,
Chairman of the Board of Cowles Broadcasting and former owner of V/REC AM & TV in
Memphis, has invited those attending the conference to be his personal guests for a
social hour to be held in the bomb shelter on his estate. Mr. Wooten's shelter, one of
the most unique in existence, is designed to accommodate 56 people for a period of
three weeks in an area of some 5500 square feet. It has excellent recreational
facilities, and a communications room providing world-wide radio contact. The shelter
will comfortably hold 125 people for a party, and arrangements are being made for us
to visit in two groups on Friday evening.
LEGISLATION AND BROADCASTING: In addition to our general session on this subject
with Mr. Phillip H. DesMarais, Deputy Assistant Secretary for Education, Department
of Health, Education and Welfare, Mr. Bob Rowland, ETV Specialist with the ETV
Facilities Program office in Washington will be at the conference on Friday and Saturday
for personal conferences with those considering applications under the Federal ETV
Facilities Act.
RADIO PRODUCTION: Those planning on attending the special interest session on radio
production Friday morning will have the opportunity to hear Mr. Will Lewis, Director of
Broadcasting at WBUR, Boston, discuss some of the techniques and ideas adaptable to
various kinds of stations.
COLLOCATION SERVICE: For those interested in position or personnel availabilities, a
special booth will be open under the supervision of Mr. Roy Johnston of the University
of Miami. By means of a card system, registrants will be able to contact each other
concerning these matters. We will have more details on this later, but we particularly
urge those seeking staff members to contact this service as soon as possible after
arrival. The service is free.
WEATHER REPORT: If you are selecting your wardrobe for the trip to Memphis, you might
like to know that the weather will probably be mild. Sixty-seven degrees is the normal
high for the city on April 1st; normal low is 46 degrees, with an average temperature of
fifty-seven degrees on that date.
INTERCONNECTION: Along with the previously announced participants in the inter .
connection session, Messrs. Witherspoon, Press and Berenson, the panel will include
Mr. John Hamblen, Director of Computer Sciences Project, SREB; and Mr. Gerard Appy,
Director of Field Services for NET.
ADVANCE REGISTRATION: An extra copy of the advance . Registration and Reservation form
is enclosed. May we remind you of the $1.50 saving to those who put their checks in the
mail by March 15, and encourage everyone to register in advance for the conference, if
at all possible, so that we may better plan for your visit.
